comment.author: 14190599@N05
comment._content: Thanks for the posting. Darley was the first true American illustrator and he was an art patriot. Learn more about him on his web site. www.focdarley.org

comment.author: 14190599@N05
comment._content: www.focdarley.org no longer is online // Ray

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/14190599@N05] That's too bad! There's always Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F._O._C._Darley. There are a few examples of his work there. Also, the Smithsonian's Archives of American Art has some of his papers: www.aaa.si.edu/collections/felix-octavius-carr-darley-let... and a caricature portrait profile of Emanuel Leutze done by Darley: www.aaa.si.edu/collections/leutze-graphic--foc-darley-6484 Best, Catherine Shteynberg Smithsonian Institution Archives
